insults.shade: Bless your heart
Your code's about as organized as a tornado in a trailer park
You're about as useful as a screen door on a submarine
That code won't compile
Your documentation's about as helpful as instructions on a boot heel
Bless your little cotton socks
Not the sharpest compiler in the IDE
Your family tree's a wreath, isn't it?
You're only cultured in that you've got bacteria
You've never had a library card, have you?
You owe your grandma money don't you
As an outsider, what are your views on human intelligence?
Your git history's about as clean as a mud-wrestlin' pig
If brains were leather, you couldn't saddle a junebug
Well, isn't that special
Your code's about as smooth as a corn cob
Might wanna rethink that PR, sugar
Your codebase looks like a squirrel's nest in a hurricane
Your commit messages are just like your mama's - bless her heart
Your debugging skills are about as sharp as a penny in a mud puddle
Well, ain't that something
If your code was dynamite, you couldn't blow your nose
Oh honey, who told you that nested ternary was a good idea?
Your test coverage is about as useful as tits on a bull
Bless your heart, you're trying
Your code review skills are about as sharp as a marshmallow
Well, God loves your code anyway
Your refactoring's about as graceful as a cow on roller skates
Did your mama raise you to write spaghetti code?
Doesn't have enough sense to comment their code
Bless your heart, you can't help it
Your algorithmic complexity is about as efficient as molasses in January
You're just tired, aren't you, sugar?
If ignorance is bliss, your code must be paradise
Oh sweetie, no
Your error handling's about as useful as a pocketful of firecrackers in a rainstorm
Well, isn't that interesting
Your code optimization's about as effective as a chocolate teapot
You're just special, aren't you?
Your variable naming's clearer than mud, but just barely
Oh, you poor thing
All syntax and no logic
Well, you sure are trying hard
Your code's about as organized as a raccoon's garage sale
Bless your heart, you mean well
The compiler's running but the logic's dead
Oh honey, that's not how we format our code
Your documentation's about as clear as a sundial at midnight
Well, somebody's mentor didn't teach them better
You're about as sharp as a sack of wet mice
Bless your sweet little heart
Your code reviews are just a few cards short of a full deck
Oh darlin', you tried
Your code's so bad it makes COBOL look modern
If I had a dollar for every anti-pattern in your code, I'd be richer than Bill Gates
Your code belongs in a museum of horrors
I've seen better code written by a cat walking across a keyboard
Calling your code a dumpster fire would be an insult to dumpsters
